name: William
originNotes: Germanic roots, English royalty. A consistently popular name for centuries.
famous_namesakes: William Shakespeare (playwright), Prince William (Duke of Cambridge), Bill Gates (entrepreneur), William Wordsworth (poet)

name: Olivia
originNotes: Latin origin, popularized by Shakespeare. Consistently a top name in recent years.
famous_namesakes: Olivia Newton-John (singer/actress), Olivia Wilde (actress/director), Olivia Colman (actress)

name: James
originNotes: Hebrew origin, via Greek and Latin. A biblical name with a long history of royal use.
famous_namesakes: King James I (of England), James Dean (actor), James Brown (musician), James Joyce (writer)

name: Sophia
originNotes: Greek origin. Popular among European royalty and has seen a resurgence in modern times.
famous_namesakes: Sophia Loren (actress), Sofia Coppola (director), Princess Sophia (various European royalty)

name: Henry
originNotes: Germanic origin. A name borne by many English kings and popular throughout history.
famous_namesakes: Henry VIII (King of England), Henry Ford (industrialist), Henry David Thoreau (philosopher), Prince Harry (Duke of Sussex)

name: Isabella
originNotes: Hebrew origin, a variation of Elizabeth. Popular in many cultures and has a royal history.
famous_namesakes: Queen Isabella I of Castile, Isabella Rossellini (actress), Isabella Bird (explorer)

name: Alexander
originNotes: Greek origin. A historically significant name, borne by Alexander the Great.
famous_namesakes: Alexander the Great (king/conqueror), Alexander Hamilton (US statesman), Alexander Graham Bell (inventor)

name: Ava
originNotes: Multiple possible origins including Germanic, Latin, and Hebrew. Short, sweet, and very popular.
famous_namesakes: Ava Gardner (actress), Ava DuVernay (director)

name: Noah
originNotes: Hebrew origin. A biblical name that has gained immense popularity in recent decades.
famous_namesakes: Noah (biblical figure), Noah Wyle (actor), Noah Centineo (actor)

name: Emma
originNotes: Germanic origin. A classic name that has enjoyed consistent popularity, especially in recent years.
famous_namesakes: Emma Watson (actress), Emma Stone (actress), Emma Thompson (actress), Jane Austen's 'Emma'

name: Liam
originNotes: Irish origin, a short form of William. Extremely popular in many English-speaking countries.
famous_namesakes: Liam Neeson (actor), Liam Hemsworth (actor), Liam Gallagher (musician)

name: Charlotte
originNotes: French origin, feminine form of Charles. A royal name with enduring appeal.
famous_namesakes: Charlotte Brontë (author), Queen Charlotte (various royalty), Princess Charlotte of Cambridge

name: Oliver
originNotes: Latin origin, related to Olivia. Popularized by Dickens' 'Oliver Twist'.
famous_namesakes: Oliver Cromwell (English leader), Oliver Stone (director), Oliver Hardy (comedian)

name: Amelia
originNotes: Germanic origin. A vintage name that has made a significant comeback.
famous_namesakes: Amelia Earhart (aviator), Amelia Bloomer (women's rights activist)

name: Elijah
originNotes: Hebrew origin. A prominent biblical prophet's name, consistently popular.
famous_namesakes: Elijah (biblical prophet), Elijah Wood (actor)

name: Mia
originNotes: Scandinavian/German/Italian short form of Maria or Amelia. Short, chic, and globally popular.
famous_namesakes: Mia Farrow (actress), Mia Hamm (soccer player), Mia Wasikowska (actress)

name: Benjamin
originNotes: Hebrew origin. A biblical name with a gentle yet strong image.
famous_namesakes: Benjamin Franklin (US statesman/inventor), Benjamin Harrison (US President), Benjamin Netanyahu (Israeli PM)

name: Harper
originNotes: English occupational surname. Gained popularity as a first name in recent times, partly due to Harper Lee.
famous_namesakes: Harper Lee (author), Harper Beckham (daughter of David and Victoria Beckham)

name: Lucas
meaning: Bringer of light; from Lucania (an ancient district of Italy).
originNotes: Latin origin, related to Luke. An internationally popular name.
famous_namesakes: George Lucas (filmmaker), Lucas Cranach (painter)

name: Evelyn
originNotes: English surname, possibly from Norman French Aveline. A vintage name that has become very fashionable.
famous_namesakes: Evelyn Waugh (author - male, but name is predominantly female now), Evelyn Keyes (actress)
